Explanation: Motif recognized by Com peptide.

Name: PBSa
Explanation: Motif recognized by PUFa. Inserted as tandem copies at sgRNA 3′ end to recruit proteins.

Name: PBSb
Explanation: Motif recognized by PUFb.  Inserted as tandem copies at sgRNA 3′ end to recruit proteins.

Name: PBSw
Explanation: Motif recognized by PUFw. Inserted as tandem copies at sgRNA 3′ end to recruit proteins.

Name: PBSc
Explanation: Motif recognized by PUFc. Inserted as tandem copies at sgRNA 3′ end to recruit proteins.

Name: Hammerhead (HH) ribozyme
Explanation: Minimal hammerhead (HH) ribozyme for multiplexing sgRNAs. The first 6 Ns are the reverse complement of the first 6 bases of the spacer. The last 6 Ns correspond to the first 6 bases of the spacer. The remaining 14 nucleotides of the spacer are appended behind this.

Name: HDV ribozyme
Explanation: Hepatitis Delta Virus (HDV) ribozyme for multiplexing sgRNAs.

Name: HH ribozyme
Explanation: Hammerhead (HH) ribozyme for multiplexing sgRNAs.

Name: HH ribozyme cleavage site
Explanation: Hammerhead (HH) ribozyme recognition site. Can be cleaved when full HH ribozyme (entry 14) is present on the same transcript.

Name: RiboJ
Explanation: RiboJ ribozyme, derived from the Satellite tobacco ringspot virus (sTRSV) ribozyme.

Name: RiboJ(T)
Explanation: Truncated version of RiboJ.

Name: RiboJ(T1)
Explanation: Truncated version of RiboJ. Best performance among tested RiboJ variants.

Name: RiboJ(T2)
Explanation: Truncated version of RiboJ.

Explanation: Ribozyme tested in E. coli screen. Good activity.

Name: csgRNA (RNA cyclase ribozyme)
Explanation: Ribozymes to create circular sgRNA in E. coli, higher efficiency than linear sgRNAs for CBE and ABE.

Name: csgRNA (Twister)
Explanation: Twister ribozymes to create circular sgRNA in mammalian cells. Lower genome editing efficiency than linear sgRNAs.
